author: @WITN
title: Volunteers plant marsh grass at Fort Macon State Park to help coastline
text: Volunteers plant marsh grass at Fort Macon State Park to help coastline BEAUFORT, N.C. (WITN) ‚Äî Volunteers are planting thousands of tiny marsh grass plants to help with restoration efforts at Fort Macon State Park. The plants, called Spartina Alterniflora, help filter pollutants out of the water, according to Coastal Resiliency Manager Sarah Bodin. This is part of the North Carolina Coastal Federation‚Äôs mission to bolster the park‚Äôs natural defenses against environmental stressors. ‚ÄúThis restoration project is fundamental to preserving the health of our coastal ecosystems, which serve as vital habitats and natural filters,‚Äù said Bodin. Meanwhile, researchers from NC State University and Duke University are studying ways to refine marsh restoration techniques. ‚ÄúOur research aims to evaluate the ecological impact of various planting strategies on habitat restoration and biodiversity enhancement,‚Äù NC State Post-Doctoral Researcher Trevyn Toone explained. Nearly 4,000 plants were put into the ground through this event. Copyright 2024 WITN. All rights reserved.

author: AOL Staff
title: 'Going to the pub for a pint saved me from tornado'
text: 'Going to the pub for a pint saved my life during the Manchester tornado' A man whose street was damaged when a [tornado tore through his town](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/what-causes-a-tornado-and-when-was-the-last-one-in-the-uk-104914596.html) has said diverting to the pub on his way home "saved his life". Euan Welsh, 21, was in Wetherspoons when 80mph winds swept through Stalybridge, Greater Manchester, on Wednesday (27 December) [during Storm Gerrit](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/storm-gerrit-thousands-without-power-092914696.html). The 'localised tornado', caused by a supercell thunderstorm during the storm, left at least 100 homes damaged. Pictures show houses with gaping holes in their roofs, leaving people forced to stay elsewhere, while dozens of cars were battered by falling bricks, trees and debris. At the time, dozens of locals were advised to stay inside due to the severity of the damage caused and risk to public safety, but Welsh said a decision to go to the pub instead had saved his life. The 21-year-old, who lives on Cherry Grove in Stalybridge, said: "I was in Wetherspoons when it happened. The windows from the Bistro next to it came in. I just finished work and I was going to walk home when I decided to go to the pub - so a pint saved my life possibly." Recommended reading [‚ÄòLocalised tornado‚Äô damages 100 properties as Storm Gerrit sweeps UK](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/properties-damaged-localised-tornado-storm-074648569.html)(PA Media) [This is when the last tornado in the UK was as Storm Gerrit hits UK](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/last-tornado-uk-brits-brace-094850844.html)(The Argus) [What is a tornado, how big can they get and how many occur in the UK each year?](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/tornado-big-many-occur-uk-121553109.html)(The Bolton News) Welsh's father Kevin Welsh, 57, said he had "never experienced anything like this" since he moved into the property 36 years ago. He said: "I was watching the Woman in Black when I heard all this noise outside. I've lived here for 36 years and never experienced anything like this. We do get strong winds but only in one direction, this was came from every direction and lasted all of one minute." Lyndsey Moody, 45, lives on nearby Hill Hough Road with her husband and two children and was one of the worst affected by the tornado. In a similar story of luck sparing them injury, she said a chimney fell through the house and onto her son's bed but fortunately he wasn't in it. She said: "We had animals in the house - the dog, three cats and a turtle, when it hit. There was one in the front bedroom, a chimney fell through and almost killed my son - if he was in bed the chimney would've killed him." Jeffrey Sheehan, 68, was out walking his dog just 10 minutes before the high winds struck. He said: "We had just got in from walking the dog, we put him to bed then not even 10 minutes later we heard this noise. My wife said it has just started to hailstone and I said ‚ÄòI was just out there, it must just be heavy rain.‚Äô "Then, it was like someone was throwing rocks at the windows and there was this loud swoosh sound. We looked outside and there was a roof blowing past the window. It's nothing like I've ever experienced before." Avoid the area Chief Superintendent Mark Dexter urged members of the public to "avoid the area" because of the amount of debris on the road. He thanked the community for their cooperation and patience and said: "This has understandably caused some disruption and, though we are not yet in a position to confirm when the area will return to normal, further updates will be communicated when we have them." Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said, but [a GoFundMe page](https://www.gofundme.com/f/stalybridge-tornado) has been set up to support those who have been affected by the tornado. Where is the safest place to be in a storm? While another storm isn't forecast imminently, there have been several storms in recent weeks. During a storm, the Red Cross advises that if you hear thunder, you should seek shelter indoors. It says: "Hearing thunder is a warning that you are within striking distance of the storm so head to any enclosed building or a car with a hard-topped metal roof and windows wound up will offer protection. If there‚Äôs a thunderstorm warning in place, then make sure to plan your day around it. Don‚Äôt plan outdoor events and avoid activities like fishing or golf. If you‚Äôre traveling somewhere, delay the journey." It adds: "If you can‚Äôt find shelter, the Met Office advises you to: 'Squat close to the ground, with hands on knees and with the head tucked between them. Try to touch as little of the ground with your body as possible, do not lie down on the ground'.

author: Roberto Pezzali
title: Galaxy S25, Qualcomm su tutti i modelli. Samsung in difficolt√† sui 3 nm | DDay.it
text:
Samsung Semiconductor sta faticando con il nodo da 3 nm, tanto che secondo alcuni ha deciso di puntare direttamente sui 2 nm perch√© la battaglia sul nodo attualmente in uso √® gi√† persa. Con il rischio, per la produzione degli Exynos, di doversi affidare a TSMC. Secondo le indiscrezioni che arrivano dalla Corea il rendimento del nodo a 3 nm di Samsung sarebbe del 25% , troppo basso per una produzione di massa: gli Exynos devono aspettare.
Per questo motivo per la prima volta lo Snapdragon 8 Elite for Galaxy, questo sar√† il nome del processore, verr√† usato su tutta la serie S25, dai modelli base al modello Ultra a livello globale .
Non si tratta ovviamente di una decisione presa di recente, Samsung sapeva della cosa gi√† lo scorso anno e aveva gi√† preso la sua decisione: simbolica la presenza allo Snapdragon Summit di TM Roh, il boss degli smartphone Samsung quasi a mettere la firma su una partnership che dura ormai da anni. Durante lo Snapdragon Summit Cristiano Amon, Presidente di Qualcomm, aveva anche mostrato quelle che sono le prestazioni della versione per i Galaxy degli Snapdragon 8 Elite, con un leggerissimo incremento dovuto alla frequenza di clock pi√π alta.
Con l‚Äôarrivo dell‚ÄôIA la scelta di Samsung di avere a bordo una sola ed unica piattaforma √® perfettamente sensata: Galaxy AI utilizza un mix di modelli locali (Gauss e Gemini Nano) e modelli in cloud, e avere due diversi processori da gestire vuole anche dire dover uniformare le prestazioni del processore che va pi√π veloce a quelle del processore che pi√π lento.
Lo abbiamo visto in tutti questi anni dove all‚ÄôEuropa √® stata destinata la versione con a bordo l‚ÄôExynos, migliorato tantissimi nelle ultime versioni ma ancora incapace di tenere su alcuni moduli, vedi l‚ÄôISP, il passo di Qualcomm.

author: Efe
title: La DANA dejar√° este viernes fuertes tormentas en Andaluc√≠a, bajo Ebro y Balears
text:
La DANA persistir√° este viernes con precipitaciones fuertes y persistentes en la mitad occidental de Andaluc√≠a, en el bajo Ebro y en Balears, sin descartarlas en el sur del Sistema Central occidental, seg√∫n las previsiones de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a (Aemet).
Las precipitaciones tambi√©n afectar√°n al suroeste, al Levante, a Arag√≥n, Catalunya, Balears y al suroeste de Castilla y Le√≥n, pero no se esperan o son muy poco probables en el norte de Galicia, Cant√°brico, norte de la meseta Norte y alto Ebro, aunque en el resto de las zonas no se pueden descartar.
Las temperaturas m√°ximas ir√°n en aumento en el oeste peninsular, pero sufrir√°n un descenso en el resto, mentiras que las m√≠nimas subir√°n en el suroeste y en el √°rea cant√°brica, pero no cambiar√°n en el resto.
La DANA deja pueblos cubiertos de barro y miles de personas aisladas, sin luz, agua y comida P√∫blico / Agencias En la Pen√≠nsula y Balears predominar√°n vientos de componente este y ser√°n flojos en general en interiores, pero algo m√°s intensos en los litorales, y vendr√°n con posibles intervalos fuertes en zonas de C√°diz y Balears, mientras que en Canarias soplar√°n los vientos flojos.
Cinco comunidades en alerta, Andaluc√≠a en riesgo extremo Cinco comunidades siguen este viernes en alerta ante las fuertes precipitaciones y las tormentas que se van a registrar durante el d√≠a, y en el caso de Andaluc√≠a el nivel es "rojo" (riesgo extremo) ante las intensas lluvias que se van a producir en la provincia de Huelva, que en algunos casos pueden llegar a acumular hasta 140 litros por metro cuadrado.
Est√° adem√°s en alerta naranja (riesgo importante) el Pa√≠s Valenci√†, que ha padecido durante los √∫ltimos d√≠as los efectos m√°s devastadores de la DANA y donde el n√∫mero de personas fallecidas se eleva a m√°s de 158, y las lluvias van a continuar a lo largo del d√≠a del viernes , seg√∫n los datos de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a.
La DANA en Espa√±a: ¬øC√≥mo reclamar los da√±os al seguro? P√∫blico El mapa de alertas naranja se completa con avisos en grandes √°reas de Andaluc√≠a, Balears y Catalunya , y la Aemet ha advertido de que en muchos lugares de estas comunidades las precipitaciones van a volver a superar hoy los 100 litros por metro cuadrado.
Est√° adem√°s en alerta "amarilla" (riesgo) la comunidad de Extremadura , donde las lluvias acumular√°n 15 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora, seg√∫n la informaci√≥n de la Agencia Estatal de Meteorolog√≠a.
Los avisos m√°s importantes, el nivel rojo (riesgo extremo) se concentran en el litoral de Huelva y en And√©valo y Condado, en la provincia de Huelva, donde las previsiones apuntan que se acumular√°n hasta 140 litros por metro cuadrado durante las primeras horas de la ma√±ana, aunque las lluvias continuar√°n siendo intensas y persistentes a lo largo del d√≠a.
Ciudades arrasadas y falta de suministros: los da√±os de la DANA, en im√°genes En el Pa√≠s Valenci√† los niveles de riesgo m√°s importantes para hoy (naranja) se han localizado en el litoral sur de la provincia de Val√®ncia , donde se acumular√°n, seg√∫n las previsiones, hasta 52 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora, debido, ha aclarado la Aemet, a una "c√©lula convectiva est√°tica" sobre el tercio sur de la zona afectada por el aviso (el litoral sur de la provincia).
La alerta es tambi√©n "naranja" (riesgo importante) en la provincia de Castell√≥ , donde los avisos se centran en el interior norte de la provincia y en el litoral, y en estos casos las lluvias van a ser tambi√©n muy intensas, con acumulaciones de hasta 40 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora y 100 litros en 12 horas.
En Catalunya el nivel "naranja" se concentra en el litoral y prelitoral sur de la provincia de Tarragona, donde se acumular√°n 40 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora y hasta 100 litros en 12 horas, seg√∫n los datos de la Aemet.
En Balears se ha extendido el nivel "naranja" a todas las islas por las fuertes lluvias . En estos territorios las precipitaciones van a rondar los 50 litros por metro cuadrado en una hora y en algunos puntos se pueden alcanzar los 120 litros por metro cuadrado en pocas horas.
Adem√°s de las alertas rojas y naranjas, se han activado avisos de nivel "amarillo" (riesgo) en las comunidades de Andaluc√≠a, Balears, Catalunya, Extremadura y Pa√≠s Valenci√†, ya que las lluvias van a ser tambi√©n muy fuertes en grandes √°reas de estas regiones , y en muchos puntos se van a acumular hasta 60 litros por metro cuadrado en doce horas.
Adem√°s de los avisos, la Aemet ha publicado un mensaje en la red social X en el que advierte que la situaci√≥n adversa va a continuar durante todo el fin de semana y de la importancia de consultar el estado de las carreteras antes de viajar y seguir las recomendaciones de Protecci√≥n Civil.
"Vamos a lanzar un mensaje muy claro y lo vamos a dejar fijado. La emergencia meteorol√≥gica no ha finalizado. La DANA sigue sobre Espa√±a", ha publicado la Aemet, y ha dejado fijado este mensaje en su cuenta de X.
La Aemet ha publicado este viernes un mensaje en el que informa de que ya se est√°n registrando lluvias torrenciales en localidades como Cartaya, donde se han recogido 117 litros por metro cuadrado en menos de tres horas; 70 de ellos en s√≥lo una hora. "La DANA va a seguir provocando hoy tiempo adverso", ha advertido la agencia meteorol√≥gica.
¬øTe ha resultado interesante esta noticia?
M√°s noticias

author: Jack29a
title: #31 C√≥mo perder la alcald√≠a de Pamplona y la reputaci√≥n en una sola frase
text:
[Osdransky](/user/Osdransky)a [eldiario.es](/go/link/3891544)
La plaza consistorial de Pamplona parece sanfermines en esta moci√≥n pero el PP sigue sin entender absolutamente nada!!!!
Idos a tomar por culo!!!!!!!
[#1](c1#c-1) llevan as√≠ desde la recogida de firmas para derogar el estatut catal√°n. Pero que sigan, que sigan.
[#10](c10#c-10) y eso que all√≠ ponen todos los impedimentos posibles para que la gente no vote (sobre todo los grupos poblacionales que no suelen votar a los republicanos).
[#1](c1#c-1) Positivo por el elefante uso del imperativo del verbo ir con el encl√©tico "os". Aunque la real academia admite desde hace a√±os "iros" y todos recordamos con cari√±o aquel "si me quer√©is, irse" de la gran Lola no es menos cierto que "Idos a tomar por culo" destila elegancia, clasicismo, ritmo, gracia y donaire en cada s√≠laba.
[#9](c9#c-9) No hay ning√∫n clasismo, todo lo contrario, est√° reconociendo la dureza de ese trabajo y el m√©rito que tiene hacerlo.
Es como si dijera "preferir√≠a trabajar en la mina". Se refiere a la dureza del trabajo.
No va a decir "preferir√≠a trabajar como CEO de un el√©ctrica", lo cual no suena a trabajo f√≠sico duro.
Ning√∫n clasismo, pero lo dice elpanfleto.es, manipulando, y os lo trag√°is todo sin masticar. Qu√© pena. Un poquito de capacidad cr√≠tica no os vendr√≠a mal, deber√≠ais intentarlo, aunque os cueste, debido a que hay que pensar y eso no es f√°cil para vosotros. Es m√°s f√°cil formar parte del reba√±o.
Creo que les ha retratado muy bien. Estoy un poco cansado de eldiario pero este art√≠culo es bastante adecuado.
[#0](c0#c-0) gracias
[#2](c2#c-2) Tranquilo, tienen todo el escudo medi√°tico. No lo ver√°s en el telediario de A3, salvo que esa misma frase la hubiera dicho una alcaldesa del PSOE o de SUMAR.
[#5](c5#c-5) Al hilo de lo que dices, hoy he visto las noticias de la noche de A¬∑, con Vicente Vall√©s, y, en alg√∫n momento cre√≠a que le iba a dar un infarto: los independentistas, Bildu, traici√≥n del PSOE, traici√≥n de S√°nchez y as√≠ as√≠... Uno, si sigue escuchando cree que va a llegar el final de la democracia y el apocalipsis, como m√≠nimo.
[#6](c6#c-6) es indecente lo de ese se√±or... verlo vomitar bilis de esa manera, da muchisima grima, no se como no le aconseja alguien que se modere un poco
A m√≠ el que me hace gracia es Feij√≥ diciendo que el PSOE ya no es un partido constitucionalista.
Pues no s√©, creo que debi√≥ quedarse dormido en el art√≠culo 1 porque en el 140 ya te dice de forma general c√≥mo se eligen los concejales y como son √©stos los que eligen a un alcalde.
En fin, que habr√° quien le compre el discurso, pero no hay por donde cogerlo

author: Diaro La Capital de Mar del Plata
title: El clima acompa√±√≥ la llegada de miles de turistas: la m√°xima pas√≥ los 25¬∞
text:
En la inauguraci√≥n del fin de semana largo , las condiciones clim√°ticas fueron m√°s que √≥ptimas, con m√°s de 25¬∫ y cielo despejado durante casi toda la jornada.
Desde las primeras horas de la ma√±ana, locales y visitantes poblaron todo el sector costero advirtiendo un mar calmo ideal para la observaci√≥n. Las visitas se extendieron desde Playa Grande hasta la zona de La Perla, con ocupaci√≥n de la arena despu√©s del mediod√≠a . Es que apenas pasados 5 minutos de las 12 se registr√≥ la temperatura m√°xima, con 25.1¬∫ , de acuerdo a los datos del Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional (SMN).
Mientras la fila de veh√≠culos segu√≠a ingresando por la Autov√≠a 2, un grupo de veintea√±eros compraban ‚Äúinsumos‚Äù en un supermercado de Alem. ‚ÄúLlegamos y desayunos y despu√©s nos fuimos un rato a la playa. Ahora hacemos una compra general. Haremos asado y necesitamos armar el bar para la noche‚Äù, explic√≥ uno de los j√≥venes.
En tanto, los locales gastron√≥micos con vista al mar colmaron sus espacios externos y en mucho se ofrecieron men√∫es especiales. ‚ÄúHay movimiento, ya se nota que vino gente‚Äù, analiz√≥ un mozo de una reconocida cadena de venta de churros.
‚ÄúNosotros somos de ac√°, pero estamos esperando a los primos de mi hija que est√°n llegando de Buenos Aires y quedamos de encontrarnos ac√°‚Äù, cont√≥ Julia, mientras su hija patinaba por los caminitos del Parque San Martin.
El ritmo del tr√°nsito veh√≠culos por Boulevard Mar√≠timo, en ambas manos, denotaba mayor intensidad que d√≠as pasados.
‚ÄúMir√° c√≥mo nos recibi√≥ Mar del Plata, ¬øqu√© m√°s podemos pedir?‚Äù, resumi√≥ Laura, que lleg√≥ hoy a la ma√±ana junto a su marido y apenas dejaron los bolsos en su departamento se trasladaron a la zona de Varese para tomar mate mirando el mar. Ya a la tarde, aunque el sol segu√≠a presente, el viento rot√≥ al sector sur y comenz√≥ el leve descenso de la temperatura.
Autopistas de Buenos Aires S.A ( Aubasa ), empresa que administra la autopista Buenos Aires La Plata y el Corredor Atl√°ntico, report√≥ este viernes un incremento en el tr√°nsito por ambas rutas.
Entre las 10 y las 11 de la ma√±ana, se registraron 1.113 veh√≠culos por hora en la Autov√≠a 2 a la altura del peaje de Maip√∫, mientras que en el peaje de Samboromb√≥n el tr√°nsito ascendi√≥ a 2.359 veh√≠culos por hora, considerando que desde este punto los automovilistas se desv√≠an hacia m√∫ltiples destinos de la costa bonaerense.

author: StudyFinds
title: Groundbreaking inhalable sensors developed at MIT can catch lung cancer early
text: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. ‚Äî An innovative new lung cancer test that deliver nanoparticle sensors into the lungs could significantly aid in early detection of the disease. The test involves patients using an inhaler or nebulizer to activate the sensors, which then produce detectable DNA barcodes in urine to signal the presence of cancer. The groundbreaking research, led by a team from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), has successfully demonstrated the test‚Äôs accuracy and speed in mice, proving it to be far less invasive than the currently used [CT scans](https://studyfinds.org/mri-scans-reveal-prostate-cancer/). Currently, heavy smokers over 50 are advised to undergo annual CT scans for early lung cancer detection. These scans, while effective, are not readily available to many, especially in low and middle-income countries, and often yield high false-positive rates. ‚ÄúWhen we developed this technology, our goal was to provide a method that can [detect](https://studyfinds.org/urine-test-detect-cancer-paper/) cancer with high specificity and sensitivity, and also lower the threshold for accessibility so that, hopefully, we can improve the resource disparity and inequity in early detection of [lung cancer](https://studyfinds.org/one-action-smokers-lung-cancer/),‚Äù explains Dr. Qian Zhong, a research scientist at MIT, in a [statement.](https://news.mit.edu/2024/inhalable-sensors-early-lung-cancer-detection-0105) The team‚Äôs innovation lies in their development of nanoscale polymer particles, coated with a [DNA](https://studyfinds.org/cure-cancer-dementia-mole-rats/) barcode ‚Äúreporter.‚Äù When these particles encounter proteases ‚Äì [enzymes](https://studyfinds.org/insulin-levels-pancreatic-cancer/) that are often overactive in [tumors](https://studyfinds.org/blood-test-families-history-cancer/) ‚Äì in the lungs, the reporter is released and eventually exits the body in urine. This breakthrough marks a shift from previous versions of the sensors, which were designed for intravenous delivery, to an inhalable form more suitable for low-resource settings. ‚ÄúAround the world, cancer is going to become more and more prevalent in low- and middle-income countries. The epidemiology of lung cancer globally is that it‚Äôs driven by pollution and smoking, so we know that those are settings where accessibility to this kind of technology could have a big impact,‚Äù says senior author Sangeeta Bhatia, a professor of Health Sciences and Technology, as well as Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at MIT. The researchers designed two particle formulations: one as an aerosolized solution for nebulizers and another as a dry powder for [inhalers](https://studyfinds.org/inhaler-sugar-molecule-lungs/). These particles, after inhalation, interact with proteases in the lung [tissue](https://studyfinds.org/ai-death-risk-cancer-heart-disease/). The proteases sever the DNA barcodes from the sensors, allowing them to circulate until they appear in the urine. For the urine analysis, the team developed a lateral flow test, similar to a pregnancy test, which can detect up to four different DNA barcodes without requiring any sample pre-treatment or processing. ‚ÄúThe epidemiology of lung cancer globally is that it‚Äôs driven by [pollution](https://studyfinds.org/air-pollution-lung-cancer/) and [smoking](https://studyfinds.org/aging-smoking-risk-factors-cancer/), so we know that those are settings where accessibility to this kind of technology could have a big impact. We aimed to create a test that is point-of-care available, even in low-resource settings, without the need for sample processing or amplification,‚Äù says Dr. Bhatia. ‚ÄúWe were really pushing this [test] to be point-of-care available in a low-resource setting, so the idea was to not do any sample processing, not do any amplification, just to be able to put the sample right on the paper and read it out in 20 minutes.‚Äù In their mouse model, which was genetically engineered to develop human-like lung tumors, the researchers identified a combination of four sensors that could accurately detect early-stage lung tumors. Looking forward, the team plans to test the [sensor](https://studyfinds.org/urine-test-detect-cancer-paper/) panels on human biopsy samples and hopes for clinical trials in human patients. A company named Sunbird Bio has already conducted phase one trials on a similar sensor developed by Dr. Bhatia‚Äôs lab for diagnosing [liver cancer](https://studyfinds.org/liver-cancer-african-americans/) and nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH). The researchers highlight the potential transformative impact of this accessible test, particularly in regions where CT scanning is limited. ‚ÄúThe idea would be you come in and then you get an answer about whether you need a follow-up test or not,‚Äù adds Dr. Bhatia. ‚ÄúWe could get patients who have early lesions into the system so that they could get curative [surgery](https://studyfinds.org/nanodrones-cancer-cells/) or lifesaving medicines.‚Äù The research, supported by entities like the Johnson & Johnson Lung Cancer Initiative and the National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences, marks a significant step towards democratizing lung cancer diagnostics and improving global health outcomes. [cancer](https://studyfinds.org/tag/cancer/), [lung cancer](https://studyfinds.org/tag/lung-cancer/), [Nanoparticles](https://studyfinds.org/tag/nanoparticles/), [tumors](https://studyfinds.org/tag/tumors/), [urine](https://studyfinds.org/tag/urine/)

author: Agency Report
title: Man City not ready to win Champions League yet
text: Pep Guardiola said he cannot see Manchester City winning the Champions League on current form, but believes his side will be better when they face the might of either Real Madrid or Bayern Munich next month.

author: China Southern Power Grid (CSG)
title: China Southern Power Grid pr√§sentiert auf der 2025 World Artificial Intelligence Conference zahlreiche Errungenschaften im Bereich KI
text:
SHANGHAI , 31. Juli 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Vom 26. bis 28. Juli fand in Shanghai die 2025 World Artificial Intelligence Conference (WAIC) unter dem Motto ‚ÄûGlobal Solidarity in the AI Era (Globale Solidarit√§t im Zeitalter der KI)" statt. Als strategischer Partner der Veranstaltung pr√§sentierte China Southern Power Grid (CSG) eine Ausstellung zum Thema ‚ÄûEmpowering Every kwh with AI" (Jede Kilowattstunde mit KI optimieren) und veranstaltete ein Forum, das sich mit KI-gesteuerten Innovationen im Energiesektor befasste. CSG pr√§sentierte au√üerdem auf der China AI Industry Innovation Exhibition eine Reihe von KI-gest√ºtzten Anwendungen und stellte dabei seine neuesten Initiativen zur Integration von KI in Energie- und Stromversorgungssysteme sowie zur F√∂rderung des Wachstums eines intelligenteren industriellen √ñkosystems vor.
Continue Reading
image
In den letzten Jahren hat CSG neue Technologien ‚Äì insbesondere k√ºnstliche Intelligenz ‚Äì eingef√ºhrt und eine Reihe bahnbrechender Fortschritte erzielt. Dazu geh√∂ren die St√§rkung der technologischen Basis, die Umsetzung einer Vielzahl von Demonstrationsszenarien und die Unterst√ºtzung beim Aufbau eines KI-√ñkosystems im Energiesektor. Diese Bem√ºhungen haben eine wichtige Rolle beim Aufbau des neuen Energiesystems und des neuen Stromversorgungssystems gespielt und den √úbergang der Branche zu einem kohlenstoffarmen und umweltbewussten Betrieb unterst√ºtzt.
Mit Blick auf die Zukunft wird CSG weiterhin nationale strategische Ziele priorisieren, darunter die Initiative ‚ÄûDigital China" und die umfassendere Energiewende. Das Unternehmen plant, seine Forschung im Bereich KI-Technologien zu vertiefen und deren Anwendung im gesamten Energiesektor auszuweiten, w√§hrend gleichzeitig die Zusammenarbeit entlang der gesamten Wertsch√∂pfungskette der Branche verst√§rkt wird. Mit diesen Bem√ºhungen m√∂chte CSG chinesische L√∂sungen und Fachwissen f√ºr die globale digitale und intelligente Transformation der Energiebranche sowie f√ºr die langfristigen Ziele der CO2-Emissionsspitze und CO2-Neutralit√§t beitragen.

author: The TDN
title: Into Champagne Pops Cork On First Stakes Win In Glitter Woman
text: Into Champagne (Into Mischief) debuted a 6 3/4-length winner last summer when the Churchill Downs meet was forced to shift to Ellis Park. Returning to the worktab in early November after nearly a five-month break, the filly was well-backed as the 3-5 choice. Tracking Let Them Watch (Maximus Mischief) from the second flight along the rail, the 3-year-old bided her time under a firm hold into the far turn. With a half-mile of :45.91, at the quarter pole the bay uncorked her speed and she celebrated with a professional performance by 1 1/4 lengths over Launch (Omaha Beach). ‚ÄúI'm all about developing horses,‚Äù said trainer Ian Wilkes. ‚ÄúI like to use riders who'll stay with the horse. Julien [Leparoux] was quite happy and wanted to stay with her, and he was willing to come down, so that was the thing. It's all about developing horses and trying to win the right races.‚Äù The winner's dam is responsible for a 2-year-old filly by Not This Time. Bedford Land initially sold to Three Chimneys Farm for $1.075 million at the '14 Fasig-Tipton Summer Horses of Racing Age Sale. She was then bought by Robert and Lawana Low while in-foal to Malibu Moon at the '16 Keeneland November Sale. Second dam GISW Pool Land (Silver Deputy) also produced her full-sister, SW Old Chestnut. GLITTER WOMAN S., $100,000, Gulfstream, 1-7, 3yo, f, 6f, 1:11.58, sy. 1‚ÄìINTO CHAMPAGNE, 118, f, 3, by Into Mischief 1st Dam: Bedford Land, by Speightstown 2nd Dam: Pool Land, by Silver Deputy 3rd Dam: Slew City Slicker, by Slew City Slew ($300,000 Ylg '22 KEESEP). 1ST BLACK TYPE WIN. O-Six Column Stables, LLC, Randall L. Bloch, Jim Gladden, Mike Davis and Michael Steele; B-Robert Low & Lawana Low (KY); T-Ian R. Wilkes; J-Julien R. Leparoux. $60,760. Lifetime Record: 2-2-0-0, $130,360. 2‚ÄìLaunch, 118, f, 3, Omaha Beach‚ÄìSpark, by Speightstown. ($50,000 Ylg '22 KEESEP). O-Amo Racing USA; B-Peter E. Blum Thoroughbreds, LLC (KY); T-Jorge Delgado. $19,600. 3‚ÄìKissedbyanangel, 122, f, 3, Golden Lad‚ÄìAngelinthemorning, by Street Sense. O-Rodolfo Sanchez-Salomon; B-Super C Racing Inc (MD); T-Rodolfo Sanchez-Salomon. $9,800. Margins: 1 1/4, 1 1/4, NK. Odds: 0.70, 9.30, 12.10. Also Ran: Let Them Watch, Indescriptable, Scootaloo, Caress. Click for the Equibase.com chart or VIDEO, sponsored by FanDuel TV. ü•Ç #1 INTO CHAMPAGNE ($3.40) rallies to a first stakes victory in Gulfstream Park's $100,000 Glitter Woman Stakes! This is just the second start for the filly by [@spendthriftfarm]'s Into Mischief. She was ridden by [@JulienLeparoux]for trainer [@IanWilkesRacing].
